title: "help: `}` may belong here" no longer reported

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
After https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/108297, the help message for inserting closing delims is no longer emitted. (cc @chenyukang)

### Code

I tried this code:

```rust
use std::{mem, ptr;
```

old output:
```
error: this file contains an unclosed delimiter
 --> src/main.rs:1:20
  |
1 | use std::{mem, ptr;
  |          -         ^
  |          |
  |          unclosed delimiter

error: expected one of `,`, `::`, `as`, or `}`, found `;`
 --> src/main.rs:1:10
  |
1 | use std::{mem, ptr;
  |          ^        ^
  |          |        |
  |          |        expected one of `,`, `::`, `as`, or `}`
  |          |        help: `}` may belong here
  |          unclosed delimiter

error: expected item, found `}`
 --> src/main.rs:1:20
  |
1 | use std::{mem, ptr;
  |                    ^ expected item
```

new output
```
error: this file contains an unclosed delimiter
 --> src/main.rs:1:20
  |
1 | use std::{mem, ptr;
  |          -         ^
  |          |
  |          unclosed delimiter
```

While noisy, the old output contains a concrete fix (`}` may belong here) and the new one doesn't.

### Version it worked on

<!--
Provide the most recent version this worked on, for example:

It most recently worked on: Rust 1.47
-->

It most recently worked on: rustc 1.69.0-nightly (31f858d9a 2023-02-28)

### Version with regression
master at 64165aac68af780182ff89a6eb3982e3c262266e, which will be in nightly 2023-03-01

@rustbot modify labels: +regression-from-stable-to-nightly -regression-untriaged +A-parser +A-diagnostics
